de.javasoft.swing
Class SimpleDropDownButton

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.AbstractButton
                  javax.swing.JButton
                      de.javasoft.swing.SimpleDropDownButton
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.ItemSelectable, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.beans.PropertyChangeListener, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.event.PopupMenuListener, javax.swing.SwingConstants
public class SimpleDropDownButton
extends javax.swing.JButton
implements java.beans.PropertyChangeListener, javax.swing.event.PopupMenuListener

A SimpleDropDownButton is a button with an arrow icon which opens a popup menu. The popupMenu can be accessed by SimpleDropDownButton#getPopupMenu. Optional UI-properties:

  • SimpleDropDownButton.margin - Insets, button insets.

    • Version:
    1.22, 20.04.2011
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    setArrowVisible

    Set arrow visible/invisible - default is visible.

    Parameters:
    visible - True means arrow is visible.

    isArrowVisible

    public boolean isArrowVisible()
    Returns visibility of arrow.

    Returns:
    True means arrow is visible.

    setOpenPopupByArrow

    public void setOpenPopupByArrow(boolean value)
    By default a mouse click at the arrow is not diffent to a click at the button - the popup will be always opened. If openPopupByArrow is set to true the popup will be only opened by a mouse click at the arrow area.

    Parameters:
    value - true - open popup only if arrow area is clicked
    See Also:
    getOpenPopupByArrow()

    getOpenPopupByArrow

    public boolean getOpenPopupByArrow()
    Returns openPopupByArrow setting.

    Returns:
    true - popup will be opened only if arrow area has been clicked
    See Also:
    setOpenPopupByArrow(boolean)

    setUseSmallArrowIcon

    public void setUseSmallArrowIcon(boolean value)
    Enable or disable the use of smallArrowIcons. Synthetica supports two different arrow icons - a smaller and a larger arrow. By default the smaller arrow icon is used. If a custom arrow icon is set this setting will be ignored.

    Parameters:
    value - true - smaller arrow icon is used (default), false - larger icon is used
    See Also:
    setArrowIcon(Icon)

    getUseSmallArrowIcon

    public boolean getUseSmallArrowIcon()
    Returns the value of useSmallArrowIcon.

    Returns:
    value of useSmallArrowIcon

    setArrowIcon

    public void setArrowIcon(javax.swing.Icon icon)
    Set a custom arrow icon to be used instead of the synthetica arrow icons. If no icon is set the synthetica arrow icons will be used.

    Parameters:
    icon - custom arrow icon

    getArrowIcon

    public javax.swing.Icon getArrowIcon()
    Getter for arrow icon.

    Returns:
    custom arrow icon

    setArrowIconSpace

    public void setArrowIconSpace(int space)
    Adds additional space between the arrow and the button. Default value is 4 pixel.

    Parameters:
    space - Additional arrow space.
